title: Patient Detail View UI
description:
Build Complete Patient Detail Page with Comprehensive Information Display

Create a full-featured patient detail view that presents all patient information in a well-organized, user-friendly interface with proper data handling and responsive design.

Requirements:

**Data Display Sections:**
- Demographics: Name (first, middle, last, suffix), date of birth, calculated age, gender, marital status, preferred language
- Identifiers: Medical Record Number (MRN), Social Security Number (masked/secured), insurance member ID, other facility-specific identifiers
- Addresses: Display all address types (residential, billing, mailing, emergency contact) with labels, including street, city, state, ZIP, country
- Contact Information: Phone numbers (home, mobile, work) with type labels, email addresses, preferred contact method
- Pharmacy Details: Pharmacy name, full address, phone number, fax number, hours of operation if available
- Insurance/Payer Information: Primary and secondary insurance providers, policy numbers, group numbers, coverage effective dates, subscriber information, authorization details

**Layout & Organization:**
- Group related information into distinct visual sections or cards
- Use clear headings and labels for each data category
- Implement collapsible sections for dense information areas
- Prioritize most-accessed information for prominent placement
- Maintain consistent spacing and visual hierarchy

**Data Handling:**
- Format dates consistently (consider locale-specific formats)
- Format phone numbers with standard patterns (e.g., (XXX) XXX-XXXX)
- Mask sensitive data (SSN, full account numbers) with option to reveal if authorized
- Display placeholder text or "Not provided" for missing fields
- Validate data integrity and flag inconsistencies if detected

**User Experience:**
- Implement loading skeleton or spinner during data fetch
- Show clear error messages if data retrieval fails with retry option
- Support both read-only view and edit mode (with appropriate permissions)
- Add print-friendly formatting option
- Ensure responsive design works on desktop, tablet, and mobile viewports
- Support keyboard navigation for accessibility
- Include breadcrumb navigation or clear back button

**Edge Cases to Consider:**
- Patients with multiple addresses or phone numbers of the same type
- Missing or incomplete insurance information
- Patients without assigned pharmacy
- Very long names or addresses that need proper truncation/wrapping
- Expired vs active insurance coverage indication
- Deceased patients (appropriate visual indicators)

**Performance & Technical:**
- Fetch patient data efficiently with single API call or optimized batch requests
- Cache patient data appropriately to reduce redundant requests
- Handle API timeouts gracefully
- Support deep linking to specific patient detail pages
- Maintain patient ID in URL for bookmarking/sharing capability
